F Dm F Dm Am Dm Am G C C Dm I follow the Moskva F C Down to Gorky Park Dm Am G Listening to the wind of change C Dm An August summer night Bb C Soldiers passing by Dm Am G F Dm F Dm Am Dm Am G C Listening to the wind of change
The world closing in Did you ever think That we could be so close,like brothers The future's in the air I can feel it everywhere Blowing with the wind of change
Chorus: C G Dm G Take me to the magic of the moment C G On a glory night Dm G Am Where the children of tomorrow dream away F G In the wind of change
Walking down the street Distant memories Are buried in the past forever
C Dm I follow the Moskva F C Down to Gorky Park Dm Am G Listening to the wind of change
Take me to the magic of the moment On a glory night Where the children of tomorrow share their dreams With you and me
C G Dm G Take me to the magic of the moment C G On a glory night Dm G Am Where the children of tomorrow dream away F G In the wind of change
Am G The wind of change blows straight Em G Am Into the face of time Em G Like a stormwind that will ring D C The freedom bell for peace of mind Dm Let your balalaika sing E What my guitar wants to say
Solo
Take me to the magic of the moment On a glory night Where the children of tomorrow share their dreams With you and me
Take me to the magic of the moment On a glory night Where the children of tomorrow dream away In the wind of change

C D So, so you think you can tell, Am G Heaven from Hell, blue skies from pain. D C Can you tell a green field from a cold steel rail, Am A smile from a veil G Do you think you can tell?
C D And did they get you to trade your heroes for ghosts, Am G Hot ashes for trees, hot air for a cool breeze, D C Cold comfort for change and did you exchange Am G A walk on part in the war for a lead role in a cage?
Em G Em G Em A Em A G
C D How I wish, how I wish you were here. Am G D We're just two lost souls swimming in a fish bowl, year after year, C Running over the same old ground. What have we found? Am G The same old fears. Wish you were here!
Em G Em G Em A Em A G

G C C G G Mother do ya' think they'll drop the bomb? G C D G Mother do ya' think they'll like my song? C G Mother do ya' think they'll try to break my balls? D C G G Ooooh-ah. Mother should I build the wall?
G C C G G Mother should I run for president? G C C D G G Mother should I trust the government? C G G Mother will they put me in the firing line? D C G G Ooooh-ah, is it just a waste of time?
G C Hush now baby, baby don't you cry. F C Mamma's gonna make all of your nightmares come true. F C Mamma's gonna put all of her fears into you. F C Mamma's gonna keep you right here under her wing. F C She wont let you fly, but she might let you sing. F C G Mamma's gonna keep baby cozy and warm. D C Ooooh-babe, D C Ooooh-babe, D C Ooooh-babe, of course Mamma's gonna help build the wall.
Solo:
B = bend H = hammer on P = pull off / = slide.

G C G Mother do ya' think she's good enough for me? G C D G Mother do ya' think she's dangerous to me? C G Mother will she tear your little boy apart? D C G Ooooh-ah, Mother will she break my heart?
G C Hush now baby, baby don't you cry. F C Mamma's gonna check out all your girlfriends for you. F C Mamma won't let anyone dirty get through F C Mamma's gonna wait up until you get in F C Mama will always find out where ya' been F C G Mamma's gonna keep baby healthy and clean D C Ooooh-babe, D C Ooooh-babe, D C G Ooooh-babe, you'll always be baby to me G C Mother did it need to be so high?
Well thats the tab, the right one, email me at cheese_man330@hotmail.com if u want to or anything to say. its easy mmmmk'ayyy

A D/A A D/A A Bm C#m E
A D So ya thought ya might like to go to the show A To feel the warm thrill of confusion D That space cadet glow A Tell me is something eluding you sunshine?
Bm E7 Is this not what you expected to see? C#m If you wanna find out what's behind these cold eyes? E You'll just have to claw your way through this disguise
A D A D A D A E A

D7
Gmaj7 As I reach for a peach
Gm6 Slide a line down behind a sofa in Saz Tropez
Gmaj7 Breaking a stick with a brick on the sand
Gm6 Riding a wave in the wake of an old sedan
G7 Sleeping alone in the drone of the darkness
A7 Scratched by the sand that fell from my love
C7 Deep in my dreams and I still hear her calling
D If you're alone, I'll come home
Gmaj7 Backward and homebound, the pigeon, the dove
Gm6 Gone with the wind and the rain on an airplane
Gmaj7 Born in a home with no silver spoon
Gm6 I'm drinking champagne like a good tycoon
G7 Sooner than wait for a break in the weather
A7 I'll gather my far flung thoughts together
C7 Speeding away on a wind to a new day
D If you're alone, I'll come home
Gmaj7 And I'll pause for a while by a country stile
Gm6 And listen to the things they say
Gmaj7 Digging for gold in a hole in my hand
Gm6 Open the book, take a look at the way things stand
G7 And you're leading me down to the place by the sea
A7 I hear you soft voice calling to me
C7 Making a date for later by phone
D And if you're alone, I'll come home
Gmaj7 Gm6

INTRO VERSE: E E D D D E White man came across the sea C C D G A He brought us pain and misery E E D D D D E He killed our tribes, he killed our creed C C D G G A He took our game for his own need
INTRO VERSE: We fought him hard we fought him well Out on the plains we gave him hell But many came too much for cree Oh will we ever be set free?
INTRO VERSE:
D (vamp) Riding through dustclouds and barren wastes
C (vamp) Bb B C Galloping hard on the plains
D (vamp) Chasing the redskins back to their holes
C (vamp) Bb B C Fighting them at their own game
A C Murder for freedom a stab in the back F D Women and children and cowards attack
CHORUS:
G F C G Run to the hills run for your lives G F C G Run to the hills run for your lives
VERSE: Soldier blue on the barren wastes Hunting and killing their game Raping the women and wasting the men The only good indians are tame Selling them whisky and taking their gold Enslaving the young and destroying the old
GUITAR SOLO
CHORUS: Run to the hills run for your lives

Intro: E G F# E E C D
E E C D Just sixteen a pick up truck E E G A Out of money out of luck E E C D Ive got no place to call my own E E G A Hit the gas and here I go
E G E D E E C D Im running free yeah, Im running free Im running free yeah, Im running free
Spend the night in an l.a. jail Listen to the sirens wail But they aint got a thing on me Im running wild Im running free
Im running free yeah, Im running free Im running free yeah, Im running free (get out my way!)
Solo
Interlude x3 (E)
ECD
Im running free yeah, Im running free Im running free yeah, Im running free
Bridge - EE, DEE , DEE, CCCDDD. X4
Pulled her at the bottle top Whiskey dancing disco hop And all the boys are after me And thats the way its gonna be
Im running free yeah, Im running free Im running free yeah, Im running free
E G A C D

Em C D I'm waiting in my cold cell, when the bell begins to chime. Em C D Em Reflecting on my past life and it doesn't have much time. C D Em 'Cause at 5 o'clock they take me to the Gallows pole, C D Em The sands of time for me are running low.
Em When the priest comes to read me the last rites, G C I take a look through the bars at the last sights, A D B E B C Of a world that has gone very wrong for me. Em Can it be that there's some sort of error. G C Hard to stop the surmounting terror. A D B E B C Is it really the end, not some crazy dream?
Em Somebody please tell me that I'm dreaming, C It's not so easy to stop from screaming, D B E B C But words escape me when i try to speak. Em Tears flow but why am I crying, C After all I'm not afraid of dying. D B E B C Don't I believe that there never is an end.
Em As the guards march me out to the courtyard, C Somebody cries from a cell "God be with you". D B E B C If there's a God then why has he let me go?
Em As I walk all my life drifts before me, C Though the end is near I'm still not sorry. D B E B C Catch my soul, it's willing to fly away.
Em Mark my words believe my soul lives on. C Don't worry now that I have gone. D I've gone beyond to see the truth.
Em When you know that your time is close at hand. C Maybe then you'll begin to understand, D B E B C Em Bm C Life down here is just a strangeillusion
B Em A D G C A D Yeah, Yeah, Yeah... Hallowed Be Thy Name

G Em Em7 Old Pirates, yes, they rob I. C G/B Am Sold I to the merchant ships G Em C G/B Am minutes after they took I from the bottomless pit. G Em Em7 But my hand was made strong C G/B Am By the hand of the Almighty. G Em C Am7 D We forward in this generation triumphantly.
(D) G C D G Won't you help to sing these songs of freedom? C D Em C D G C Cause all I ever had, redemption songs, D G C D redemption songs.
(D) G Em Em7 Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, C G/B Am None but ourselves can free our minds. G Em Have no fear for atomic energy, C G/B D Cause none of them can stop the time. G Em Em7 How long shall they kill our prophets C G/B Am While we stand aside and look? G Em Ooh, some say it's just a part of it. C Am7 D We've got to fulfill the book.
(D) G C D G Won't you help to sing these songs of freedom? C D Em C D G C Cause all I ever had, redemption songs, D G C D G C D redemption songs, redemption songs.
Em C D (4x)
(D) G Em Em7 Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, C G/B Am None but ourselves can free our minds. G Em Woh, Have no fear for atomic energy, C G/B D Cause none of them-ah can-ah stop-ah the time. G Em Em7 How long shall they kill our prophets C G/B Am While we stand aside and look? G Em Yes, some say it's just a part of it. C Am7 D We've got to fulfill the book.
(D) G C D G Won't you help to sing these songs of freedom? C D Em C D G Cause all I ever had, redemption songs, C D Em C D Em C All I ever had, redemption songs, D G C D G These songs of freedom, songs of freedom
C Em Am D

MAIN RIFF E B Bb A (4x)
G G If you like to gamble, I tell you I'm your manyou win some, lose some, it's G G G all the same to me (main riff 2x) D C The pleasure is to play, it makes no difference what you say D C I don't share your greed, the only card I need isthe MAIN RIFF 4X Ace of Spades the Ace of Spades
G G G Playin' for the high one, dancin' with the devil going with the flow, it's G G G all a game to me (main riff 2x) D C 7 or 11, snake eyes watching you D C Double up or quit, double stake or split MAIN RIFF 4X the Ace of Spades the Ace of Spades
E D E You know I'm born to lose and gamblin's made for fools (n.c.) But that's the way I like it baby I don't want to live forever
D E D C
and don't forget the joker
(solo- dont know what the chords are here)
G G G Pushing up the ante, I know you got to see me read 'em and weep, G G G G G the dead man's hand again (main riff 2x) D C I see it in your eyes, take one look and die D C The only thing you see, you know it's gonna be MAIN RIFF 2X the Ace of Spades the Ace of Spades

Am Bmaj7/G# | C/G D/F# | Fmaj7 | Am/B Am
Fmaj7 Am Bmaj7/G# C/G D/F# There's a lady who's sure all that glitters is gold Fmaj7 Am/B Am And she's buying a stairway to heaven. Fmaj7 Am Bmaj7/G# C/G D/F# When she gets there she knows, if the stores are all closed Fmaj7 Am/B Am With a word she can get what she came for. C D Fmaj7 C G Dsus4 D Ooh, ooh, and she's buying a stairway to heaven.
Am Cmaj7 D Fmaj7 Am There's a sign on the wall but she wants to be sure Am C D Fmaj7 'Cause you know sometimes words have two meanings. Fmaj7 Am Bmaj7/G# C/G D/F# In a tree by the brook, there's a songbird who sings, D/F# C Am/B Am Sometimes all of our thoughts are misgiven.
Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it makes me wonder, Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it makes me wonder.
D C G/B Asus2 Am There's a feeling I get when I look to the west, Am C G/B Fmaj7#11 Am And my spirit is crying for leaving. Am C G/B Asus2 Am In my thoughts I have seen rings of smoke through the trees, Am C G/B Fmaj7 Am And the voices of those who stand looking.
Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it makes me wonder, Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it really makes me wonder.
D C G/B Asus2 Am And it's whispered that soon if we all call the tune D C G/B Fmaj7#11 Then the piper will lead us to reason. D C G/B Asus2 Am And a new day will dawn for those who stand long D C G/B Fmaj7#11 And the forests will echo with laughter.
C G/B Am Am/B If there's a bustle in your hedgerow, don't be alarmed now, C G/B Fmaj7 Am It's just a spring clean for the May queen. C G/B Am Am/B Yes, there are two paths you can go by, but in the long run C G/B Fmaj7 Am There's still time to change the road you're on.
Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it makes me wonder, Am7 Am Dsus2 D Am7 Am Em D C D Ooh, it really makes me wonder.
C G/B Am Am/B Your head is humming and it won't go, in case you don't know, C G/B Fmaj7 Am The piper's calling you to join him, C G/B Am Am/B Dear lady, can you hear the wind blow, and did you know C G/B Fmaj7 Am Your stairway lies on the whispering wind.
C G D Dsus2 D Dsus4
Dsus2 D Dsus4 Dsus2 D Dsus4 Dsus4 D Cadd9
Am Am7 Fmaj7 x8
Am G F G/G# And as we wind on down the road Am G F G/G# Our shadows taller than our soul. Am G F G/G# There walks a lady we all know Am G F G/G# Who shines white light and wants to show Am G F G/G# How everything still turns to gold. Am G F G/G# And if you listen very hard Am G F G/G# The tune will come to you at last. Am G F G/G# When all are one and one is all Am G F G/G# To be a rock and not to roll.
Am Am7 x4
Fmaj7
And she's buying a stairway to heaven.

D She's got a smile that it seems to me Cadd9 Reminds me of childhood memories G D Where everything was as fresh as a bright blue sky D Now and then when i see her face Cadd9 She takes me away to that special place G D And if i stay too long I'd probably break down and cry
A C D Oooooh Sweet Child of Mine A C D Oooooh Sweet Love of Mine
D She's got eyes of the bluest sky Cadd9 And if they thought of rain G D I'd hate to look into those eyes and see an ounce of pain D Her hair reminds me of a warm safe place Cadd9 Where as a child i'd hide G D And prey for the thunder and the rain to quietly pass me by
A C D Oooooh Sweet Child of Mine A C D Oooooh Sweet Love of Mine
